scene.name: intro
scene.line: Excuse me, ma'am, I saw the light was on and I'm looking for the on-ramp to —
scene.option: Are you here to kick me off the property?
Do you believe in ghosts?

scene.name: kick-off-property
scene.line: Oh, no, no ... I guess you don't belong here either, do you?
scene.option: Do you work for the power company?
Are you just out wandering?

scene.name: power-company
scene.line: The power company? Oh, no, no. I once worked for an electrician for a few weeks, but I sort of drifted on before I really learned anything.
scene.option: I get it. You're a nomad.
I get it. You're a drunk.

scene.name: wandering
scene.line: Ha. Well, I do drive a lot. Just me and the road mostly, when the sun is out.
scene.option: You sound lonely.
Is that your job? Driving?

scene.name: lonely
scene.line: Nah, I get by.

scene.name: drunk
scene.line: Nah, I do a pretty good job now, I keep sober. I've got a gig.

scene.name: believe-in-ghosts
scene.line: Well, let's see ... I do believe a place can be haunted, if that's what you mean.
scene.option: What about a person? Can a person be haunted?
No, that's not what I mean.

scene.name: person-be-haunted
scene.line: Sure, I guess a person could. Sometimes I feel haunted myself.
scene.option: What haunts you?
Me too.

scene.name: what-haunts-conway
scene.line: Uh ... bad decisions, I guess. Wasted youth. Ha. Well, look ...

scene.name: not-place-haunted
scene.line: Well, OK, I've run across a few people who acted like ghosts. Kinda there, kinda ... somewhere else.
scene.option: Me too.
So what brings you to this old mine tonight?

scene.name: shannon-haunted-too
scene.line: Oh yeah? Did, uh ... is that what lead you down here?
scene.option: Yes.
I don't want to talk about it anymore.

scene.name: shannon-ghosts-led-down
scene.line: So. I guess this place must be pretty important. Maybe I'm in the right place after all.

scene.name: shannon-doesnt-want-to-talk-about-ghosts
scene.line: OK. You seem like you've got a lot on your mind. I don't mean to bother you. It's just ...

scene.name: conway-business-in-mine
scene.line: Here's what it is: I drive deliveries for a shop called Lysette's Antiques, and I'm out trying to finish this job.
scene.option: You're making a delivery to the mine?
What kind of stuff are you hauling?

scene.name: deliver-to-mine
scene.line: Oh, uh ... no.

scene.name: looking-for-dogwood
scene.line: I have a delivery for "5 Dogwood Drive," and I can't remember ever seeing that address before. Now I heard I need to take a highway called the |Zero|.
So I met this young lady, name of Weaver Márquez, and she sent me this way, and so here I am. Uncommon kind of place for an on-ramp, but that's what it's been like so far anyway with —

scene.name: whats-in-delivery
scene.line: Antiques. Good stuff. Lysette has a sharp eye, for the little good it's done her lately. You know, it's just one recession after another, everybody's selling their old stuff cheap but nobody's really buying ...

scene.name: switch
scene.line: What?
scene.option: Weaver Márquez. Do you know her?
The |Zero|, is that around here?

scene.name: know-weaver
scene.line: So you saw her. Tonight. I know Weaver. She was ... she's my cousin. I'm Shannon Márquez.
scene.option: Oh, you're the one who fixes televisions.
I get it. She tricked me.

scene.name: fixes-televisions
scene.line: That's right. Did she tell you that, too? Of course she did.

scene.name: zero-nearby
scene.line: I've never heard of the damned "|Zero|." That doesn't sound like a real highway. But I know Weaver. I've known her all my life, she was ... she's my cousin. I'm Shannon Márquez.

scene.name: weaver-doesnt-lie
scene.line: Weaver doesn't lie. One time, when we were younger, she told me my dad had been in a terrible car wreck. There was crushed metal everywhere, and we'd be hearing it echo through the house for years, she said. I was very upset, crying, and then my dad walked in the door, just come back from a trip to the junkyard collecting scrap metal to fashion into wind chimes.
I was angry, but she said it wasn't a joke, and it wasn't a lie. At the time I thought she meant it as a riddle or a puzzle.
But Weaver's not a puzzle. She's a mystery.
scene.option: So, maybe the |Zero| `is` down here somewhere.
So, what are `you` doing down here, Shannon?

scene.name: zero-somewhere
scene.line: Maybe it is. Well, I won't mind the company. I've got business down here, myself.

scene.name: shannon-business
scene.line: I talked to Weaver earlier this evening, too. Or anyway, she talked to me; it's hard to tell if she's listening sometimes.
Weaver told me I had to come down here to the old Elkhorn Mine. She said I'd find ... something I've been looking for.
scene.option: Where did you see Weaver?
What are you looking for?

scene.name: where-was-weaver
scene.line: At my workshop. She just appeared. I hadn't seen her since ... a long time.

scene.name: what-shannon-is-looking-for
scene.line: I'm not exactly sure. I have a few ideas ... I'll know it when I see it.

scene.name: next-steps
scene.line: It's not such a bad thing, you showing up now. All told, I'd rather not go down there alone. Your dog should stay up here, though. It's no place for a dog.
This is an old mine. It runs pretty deep and tangled. If we're going to go down into it, find your on-ramp and whatever else, we've got to keep our bearings. I don't want to get turned around.

I've got some gear here to measure conductivity, frequency response, stuff like that. Maybe we can find a way to put a signal out ahead, do some analysis and figure out what kind of topology we're up against.
scene.option: Topology. OK.
Sure, let's look around.

scene.name: topology
scene.line: Topology. That's the science of continuous space, my friend. The way this twisty maze of passages fits together.
